column4: Hi... is there a problem with the repos? This is the 10th or so attempt at installing i've made today and yet again a package has screwed up (seahorse) this time...
So... once more, apt is broken
you can post the errors you get to pastebin.ubuntu.com, and I will look at them,
- "dpkg: error processing seahorse (--configure):
something is broken. Try "sudo dpkg --configure -a"
- Its been like this on multiple machines with fresh installs over the past few days
post the contents of your /etc/apt/sources.list file to the pastebin. Please do not paste in the channel.
the seahorse app is somehow in limbo. Did you run that "sudo dpkg --configure -a"?

- Each time ive tried a fresh install or update something like that has happened.... i have no idea whats wrong. Its either the repos have gone dodgy or something is corrupting stuff en-route to here...
Did you run that "sudo dpkg --configure -a"?
- About 30000000 times in the last few days... its some other issue
and you get that error again, right?
- I did earlier... this is yet another fresh install
why not try now?
- It didnt work
same error, right?
and when you run sudo apt-get purge seahorse?
and when you run sudo apt-get remove --purge seahorse?
sorry to hear that. Good luck.

ya, it looks like there are CDs that will come out every once in a while with cumulative updates, but updates will always happen. What happened to your install is that some package did not get installed properly and is blocking up apt. I have fixed this on my computer before, and would be glad to help you, if you will follow some instructions and use the pastebin...
- It happened to about 20 attempts at installs, on multiple machines... with _different_ packages.
